greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominators of the fractions f(n) such that (6/Pi^2)*f(n) is the asymptotic density of the numbers k with A280292(k) = sopfr(k) - sopf(k) = n.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..214
mathematica: psi[1] = 1; psi[n_] := n*Times @@ (1 + 1/Transpose[FactorInteger[n]][[1]]); delta[ps_] := 1/psi[(Times @@ ps)*(Times @@ Union[ps])]; f[n_] := Total[delta /@ IntegerPartitions[n, Floor[n/2], Select[Range[n], PrimeQ]]]; Denominator @ Array[f, 30, 0]
results.author: _Amiram Eldar_, Nov 02 2020
